name: Construction Kit
description: The basic tool required to construct and deconstruct base elements and placeables.
operational_notes: Essential for all base building activities. The first step in establishing a foothold on Arrakis.

name: Windtrap
description: A structure that passively collects water from the air's humidity. Essential for industrial-scale water production.
operational_notes: Must be placed outdoors to function. Water generation is passive and continues while offline. A cornerstone of late-game industry.

name: Makeshift Filter
description: A basic consumable filter required for the operation of a Windtrap.
operational_notes: Consumed over time by the Windtrap. Represents an ongoing operational cost for water production.

name: Standard Filter
description: A more advanced and likely longer-lasting filter for use in a Windtrap.
operational_notes: Higher tier filter, suggesting greater efficiency or duration compared to the Makeshift version.

name: Fuel-Powered Generator
description: An early-game power generator that provides a basic amount of energy.
operational_notes: Low power output. Ideal for starter bases but becomes inefficient at scale due to the placeable item limit per land claim.

name: Directional Wind Turbine
description: A high-efficiency power generator that harnesses wind power. Offers superior power density.
operational_notes: The most critical power upgrade for scaling industrial operations. Its high output helps manage the placeable item limit.

name: Plastone
description: An artificial composite of Silicone and Basalt used in sandstorm-resistant construction.
operational_notes: The premier building material for endgame and Deep Desert construction. Recipe efficiency improves with higher-tier refineries.

name: Pentashield
description: A base's primary defensive energy shield, generated by the Sub-Fief console.
operational_notes: Power consumption is not a flat rate. It consumes 3 Watts PER TILE of area covered. This scaling cost makes it a major power sink for large bases and a key factor in base design.
